Project.Brief history of your project and organi:
RF100-VL is a large-scale collection of 100 multi-modal datasets with diverse concepts not commonly found in VLM pre-training.

The benchmark includes images, with corresponding annotations, from seven domains: flora and fauna, sport, industry, document processing, laboratory imaging, aerial imagery, and miscellaneous datasets related to various use cases for which detection models are commonly used.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File: RF100-VL introduces 100 open source datasets containing object detection bounding boxes and multimodal few shot instruction with visual examples and rich textual descriptions across novel image domains. annotations across seven domains, including aerial, biological, and industrial imagery.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: To meet the structural requirements of decentralized storage and support model training needs, we performed standardized cleaning, augmentation, and packaging of open-source datasets such as RF100-VL. We used Pillow and OpenCV for image format conversion and resizing, Albumentations for batch image augmentation (e.g., rotation, blur, noise injection), and Real-ESRGAN for high-resolution upscaling. Additionally, Stable Diffusion and ControlNet were applied to generate stylistically diverse synthetic images. Multilingual annotations were added using DeepL API and custom scripts to enhance multimodal value. Finally, we packaged the images and annotations into 32GiB/64GiB shards using our custom tooling, making them suitable for uploading to the Filecoin network and enabling future retrieval verification. This expansion does not involve malicious data inflation but is a reasonable and traceable process based on real-world usage scenarios.
